meanings.definition: The act of putting things in a particular sequence or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The ordering of books on the shelf helps me find them easily.
meanings.sent2: She completed the ordering of the numbers from smallest to largest.
meanings.sent3: The ordering of the ingredients in the recipe was crucial for a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: His ordering of tasks was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The ordering of the colors in the rainbow is always beautiful.

meanings.definition: A request for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: I placed an ordering for new office supplies yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The ordering for the new furniture arrived earlier than expected.
meanings.sent3: His ordering for a pizza delivery made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: The ordering for a birthday cake was a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent5: The ordering for a book from the library was quick and easy.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or disposition of people or things in relation to each other.
meanings.sent1: The ordering of chairs in the classroom created a neat environment.
meanings.sent2: The ordering of the flowers in the vase added beauty to the room.
meanings.sent3: The ordering of toys on the shelf made the room look organized.
meanings.sent4: The ordering of planets in the solar system is fascinating to study.
meanings.sent5: The ordering of words in a sentence affects its meaning.
